data.title: stage renal disease in critically ill patients with and wit…
data.meta_description: Abstract<jats:sec> Introduction Prevalence of chronic kidney disease (CKD) amongst intensive care unit (ICU) admissions is rising. How mortality and risk of end-stage renal disease (ESRD) differs between those with and without CKD and with acute kidney injury (AKI) is unclear. Determining factors that increase the risk of ESRD is essential to optimise treatment, identify patients requiring nephrological surveillance and for quantification of dialysis provision. </jats:sec><jats:sec> Method This cohort stud…
